## Penguin Size and Mass by Sex and Species


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(dplyr)  # Load dplyr for data manipulation
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```

Attaching package: 'dplyr'
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    filter, lag
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(palmerpenguins)  # Load palmerpenguins dataset
library(ggplot2)         # Load ggplot2 for plotting

df <- palmerpenguins::penguins  # Load penguins data
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Clean data: remove rows with NA in 'bill_length_mm' or 'body_mass_g'
df_clean <- df %>%
  filter(!is.na(bill_length_mm) & !is.na(body_mass_g))

df_clean %>%
  group_by(species, sex) %>%
  summarise(
    across(
      where(is.numeric), 
      \(x) mean(x, na.rm = TRUE)  # Calculate mean, removing NA values
      ),
    .groups = 'drop'  # Avoid grouping in the output
    ) %>%
  knitr::kable()  # Create a markdown table of the summary
```

::: {.cell-output-display}


|species   |sex    | bill_length_mm| bill_depth_mm| flipper_length_mm| body_mass_g|     year|
|:---------|:------|--------------:|-------------:|-----------------:|-----------:|--------:|
|Adelie    |female |       37.25753|      17.62192|          187.7945|    3368.836| 2008.055|
|Adelie    |male   |       40.39041|      19.07260|          192.4110|    4043.493| 2008.055|
|Adelie    |NA     |       37.84000|      18.32000|          185.6000|    3540.000| 2007.000|
|Chinstrap |female |       46.57353|      17.58824|          191.7353|    3527.206| 2007.971|
|Chinstrap |male   |       51.09412|      19.25294|          199.9118|    3938.971| 2007.971|
|Gentoo    |female |       45.56379|      14.23793|          212.7069|    4679.741| 2008.069|
|Gentoo    |male   |       49.47377|      15.71803|          221.5410|    5484.836| 2008.066|
|Gentoo    |NA     |       45.62500|      14.55000|          215.7500|    4587.500| 2008.250|


:::
:::


## Penguin Size vs Mass by Species


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
df_clean %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = body_mass_g, color = species)) +
  geom_point() +  # Scatter plot points
  geom_smooth(method = "lm") +  # Add linear regression line
  labs(
    subtitle = "geom_smooth() using formula y ~ x"  # Indicate formula used in plot subtitle
  )
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```
